contentrichtext.text: [[File:Cobalamin.svg|thumb|Cobalamin with the upper axial ligand noted as R]] '''Cobalamin''' may refer to several chemical forms of [[vitamin B12|vitamin B<sub>12</sub>]], depending on the upper axial [[ligand]] of the [[cobalt]] [[ion]]. These are: *[[Cyanocobalamin]] (R = –CN) *[[Hydroxocobalamin]] (R = –OH) *[[Methylcobalamin]] (R = –CH<sub>3</sub>), an active form of vitamin B<sub>12</sub> *[[Adenosylcobalamin]] (R = –Ado), also an active form of vitamin B<sub>12</sub> Cobalamin is susceptible to acid. During its [[Cobalamin biosynthesis|biosynthesis]] complexes are formed to protect it. {{tetrapyrroles}} [[Category:Tetrapyrroles]]
